variant.title: Procter and Gamble Keynote Speech: Mining biomedical texts for disease-related pathways
variant.author: Andrey Rzhetsky
variant.bodyText: I will describe my collaborators' and my own effort to compile large models of molecular pathways in complex human disorders. The talk will address a number of interre- lated questions: How to extract facts from texts at a large scale? How to assess the quality of the extracted facts? How to identify sets of conflicting or un- reliable facts and to generate an internally consistent model? How to use the resulting pathway model for automated generation of biological hypotheses?
variant.note: Proceedings of the BioNLP Workshop on Linking Natural Language Processing and Biology at HLT-NAACL 06, page 81, New York City, June 2006. cï¿½2006 Association for Computational Linguistics

variant.title: Procter and Gamble Keynote Speech: Mining biomedical texts for disease-related pathways
variant.author: Andrey Rzhetsky
variant.abstract: I will describe my collaborators' and my own effort to compile large models of molecular pathways in complex human disorders. The talk will address a number of interrelated questions: How to extract facts from texts at a large scale? How to assess the quality of the extracted facts? How to identify sets of conflicting or unreliable facts and to generate an internally consistent model? How to use the resulting pathway model for automated generation of biological hypotheses?
variant.note: 81 of the BioNLP Workshop on Linking Natural Language Processing and Biology at HLT-NAACL page 81, York City, June 2006. Association for Computational Linguistics
